{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3488437,"name":"","username":"TryingMyBest","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/8797f3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T21:16:10.294Z","cooked":"

Hello, our current controller has a lot of drift in it and we’ve tried everything to fix the hardware, following all the advice we could find in the internet but it still doesn’t work, so we were wondering if there was a way to fix the drift in the code. Thanks in advance

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T21:16:10.294Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":350,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":1774.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482781,"topic_slug":"how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62046,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code/482781/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3488448,"name":"Burak Şükür ","username":"Drbrk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drbrk/{size}/225740_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T21:25:10.287Z","cooked":"

As far as I know, controller drift is not a software problem but a hardware one. I think the higher the dead zone in the software, the worse it will affect your driving. If you have the chance, I think it’s best to use another controller.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T21:25:10.287Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":28.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482781,"topic_slug":"how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code","display_username":"Burak Şükür ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54433,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code/482781/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488457,"name":"","username":"TryingMyBest","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/8797f3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T21:31:37.254Z","cooked":"

Yes, its a hardware problem, but we have a very small budget and buying a new controller would be a significant hit, so I’m asking if it would be possible to adjust on the code to correct for the drift

By drift, do you mean certain wheels turn faster than others due to an offsetted center of gravity? If so, one possible solution would be multiplying the speed of those wheels by a constant.

I mean that the swerve is slightly rotating on the yaw, it switches directions but persists based on which of our 2 controllers we use so it’s definitely that.

amazon.com

Amazon.com: 8Bitdo Ultimate Wired Controller, USB Wired Controller for PC...

Amazon.com: 8Bitdo Ultimate Wired Controller, USB Wired Controller for PC Windows 10, Android, Steam Deck, Raspberry Pi and Switch (White)

Where do you want me to send them?
We use these and I’m very happy with them.

for free? Because we would much rather try to figure out a programming solution than use some of our very constrained budget on a new controller.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T00:26:30.372Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":62,"readers_count":61,"score":32.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482781,"topic_slug":"how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12688,"username":"JohnFogarty","name":"John Fogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62046,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code/482781/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488609,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T00:31:44.236Z","cooked":"

Are you using Java?

You can try a deadband, you can try recalibrating the controller in Windows, and the Driverstation screen with the controllers also has a Tare Controller button.

If none of these work, you’ll need a new controller.

github.wpilib.org

MathUtil (WPILib API 2025.2.1)

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.math, class: MathUtil

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T00:31:44.236Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":61,"readers_count":60,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482781,"topic_slug":"how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code","display_username":"John Fogarty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/math/MathUtil.html#applyDeadband(double,double)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MathUtil (WPILib API 2025.2.1)","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12688,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code/482781/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488610,"name":"Kabir","username":"kn4","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kn4/{size}/235296_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T00:33:06.838Z","cooked":"

If the controllers happen to be Xbox controllers you can use the Xbox Accessories app to recalibrate the joysticks. Many other controller manufacturers have something similar.
If the drift is constant you could try adding/subtracting a constant to the joystick X/Y values while ensuring it remains scaled from -1 to 1. You could also just increase the applied deadband in your code.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T00:45:48.540Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":26.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482781,"topic_slug":"how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code","display_username":"Kabir","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://apps.microsoft.com/detail/9nblggh30xj3","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Xbox Accessories - Free download and install on Windows | Microsoft Store","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57470,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2724 programmer"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-fix-controller-drift-in-code/482781/9","custom_user_title":"2724 programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488623,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T00:42:11.472Z","cooked":"

As a mentor on a fellow low-resource team, I get the impetus and idea to try to work around a hardware problem in software. I also think it’s a pretty low return-on-investment way to spend your build season.

For that reason, if none of the settings/calibration steps above work, I’ll buy you an 8bitdo Hall Effect controller and send it to your team. For YPP purposes, please don’t DM me 1:1, but DMing me and JohnFogarty on the same message should be OK. (If John wants to split it, we can, but it’s under $30 delivered right now. Don’t spend precious programming time trying to work around a $30 problem.)

Send your team’s address that Amazon will deliver a package to (please send the address of the school or the lead mentor, so it’s not your personal info).
